SENT.plain: The authors studied cutaneous biopsies of papulo-pustular lesions in BehÃ§et's syndrome

In biopsies taken early, superficial oedema of the dermis appeared to be the first histological sign, subsequently resulting in a true sub-epidermal bulla, containing neutrophil polynuclear and eosinophil leucocytes
At this stage no major vascular involvement was seen
In later specimens, by contrast, marked vascular changes were seen with the appearances of allergic angiitis
At this stage, there is frank epidermal necrosis with resultant ulceration
